channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Republican Rep. Mike Lawler says he won't run for New York governor
item.description: U.S. Rep. Mike Lawler, a moderate Republican representing a suburban New York swing district, said Wednesday he won't run for governor next year.

item.title: This Left-Wing Education Juggernaut Doesn’t Deserve Federal Backing
item.description: The National Education Association’s real purpose is political. That doesn’t merit a government charter.

item.title: WATCH: Lawmakers break down how billions in the 'big, beautiful bill' boost Trump's immigration crackdown
item.description: House Republicans celebrate immigration enforcement funding in Trump's bill, highlighting detention capacity, border wall construction and enforcement...

item.title: Sesame Street Will Still Be Open
item.description: It’s now on Netflix, and it remains available for free on PBS.

item.title: Chocolate cravings are about to be costlier as Hershey’s confirms price increases are on the way
item.description: Tariffs, however, are not to blame this time.

item.title: New DNI Docs Reveal Washington Post’s Central Role In Russiagate Hoax
item.description: Candid assessments were immediately overturned. The narrative was flipped, claiming that Russia had interfered to help Trump win.

item.title: AI is already touching nearly every corner of the medical field
item.description: Some universities are already incorporating AI training into their medical school courses.

item.title: Democrats Resist Clean Voter Rolls That Prevent Dead Voters In Congressional Hearing
item.description: Democrats assert that cleaning voter lists benefits Republicans. That can only be true if Democrats are using list weaknesses to cheat.

item.title: DeepSeek makes it easier for Southeast Asia’s firms to get into AI, but venture investors are still adopting a wait-and-see attitude
item.description: Granite Asia’s Jixun Foo wants to see “the confluence of talent and market adoption” before he starts investing in Southeast Asian AI.

item.title: The One Big Beautiful Bill Is an Opportunity to Renew Federalism
item.description: For the first time, states have the directive and flexibility to put the truly needy first and help able-bodied adults return to the workforce.

item.title: Coast Guard overhaul takes off amid Trump administration’s immigration, narcotics crackdown
item.description: New legislation aims to create a Coast Guard secretary position to streamline operations and elevate the service to match other military branches.

item.title: Federal judge partially blocks law banning adults from helping minors get out-of-state abortions

item.title: Nike’s Scottie Scheffler Dad Ad Signals A Serious Cultural Vibe Shift
item.description: The path forward isn’t paved with more slogans, more division, or more social experiments — it’s built on the foundation of family.

item.title: Trump Shouldn’t Fire Powell
item.description: The Fed chairman’s term will be over in ten months. Forcing him out now will mean serious institutional and reputational damage to the U.S.

item.title: Billionaire Mark Cuban reads around 700 emails every day in his quest for near inbox zero—and prefers that to ‘boring’ meetings
item.description: The billionaire ex-’Shark Tank’ investor checks his inbox between workouts, Zoom meetings, and meals—and he’d never outsource the job to an assistant.
